title: An introduction to the isajsonr package
text: isajsonr package developed easy--use package reading, modifying writing files Investigation/Study/Assay (ISA) Abstract Model metadata framework using JSON format. ISA metadata framework manage increasingly diverse set life science, environmental biomedical experiments employ one combination technologies. Built around Investigation (project context), Study (unit research) Assay (analytical measurements) concepts, ISA helps provide rich descriptions experimental metadata (.e. sample characteristics, technology measurement types, sample--data relationships) resulting data discoveries reproducible reusable.

title: An introduction to the isajsonr package
text: ISA-JSON format described full detail ISA-JSON website. ISA-JSON content regarding multiple Study Assay fall one Investigation JSON structure, therefore recorded single JSON file. JSON file .json extension.

title: An introduction to the isajsonr package
text: example working isajsonr package use data set accompanies Castrillo et al. (2007). associated file included package.

what: Reading files in the ISA-JSON format
title: An introduction to the isajsonr package
text: ISA-JSON files can stored two different ways, either stand-alone file directory, .zip file containing file. example data included stand-alone file package. formats can read R using readISAJSON function. reading ISA-JSON file directory, full location file specified. package recognize zipped file extract temporary folder reading . cases readISATab validate content .json file isa-json model scheme can found . imported ISA-JSON file stored object S4 class ISAjson. Since information almost identical reading content unzipped zipped-file, following sections show example files read unzipped file .
code: ## Read ISA-JSON file from directory. isaObject1 <- readISAJSON(file = file.path(system.file("extdata/Castrillo/Castrillo.json",                                                         package = "isajsonr")))

title: An introduction to the isajsonr package
text: information ISA-JSON file stored within content slot ISAjson object. path file originally read stored path slot. section ISA structure corresponding functions accessing modifying information. names access functions correspond section refer , e.g. accessing Ontology Source Reference (OSR) section ISAjson object can done using oSR() function. one notable exception . prevent problems path() function, already exists quite packages, path slot ISA object accessed using isaPath() function. path isaObject1 shows full path file read using readISAJSON. sections accessible similar way. examples shown . possible access information different sections ISAjson object, information can also updated. access functions, update functions name sections refer . example, let’s assume error sneaked OSR section want update one source versions. First look current content OSR section. Now update version Ontology Biomedical Investigations 47893 47894. update modified ontology source data.frame ISAjson object. similar way sections ISAjson object can accessed updated.
code: ## Access path for isaObjects isaPath(isaObject1) #> [1] "/home/runner/work/_temp/Library/isajsonr/extdata/Castrillo/Castrillo.json" ## Access studies. isaStudies <- study(isaObject1)  ## Print study names. names(isaStudies) #> [1] "filename"                      "identifier"                    "title"                         #> [4] "description"                   "submissionDate"                "publicReleaseDate"             #> [7] "Comment[Study Funding Agency]" "Comment[Study Grant Number]"  ## Access study descriptors. isaSDD <- sDD(isaObject1)  ## Shows study descriptor for study s_BII-S-1. isaSDD$`s_BII-S-1.txt` #>       annotationValue termSource                              termAccession #> 1 intervention design        OBI http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/OBI_0000115 (isaOSR <- oSR(isaObject1)) #>                                 description                                             file  name #> 1    Ontology for Biomedical Investigations http://bioportal.bioontology.org/ontologies/1123   OBI #> 2             BRENDA tissue / enzyme source        ArrayExpress Experimental Factor Ontology   BTO #> 3            NEWT UniProt Taxonomy Database                                                   NEWT #> 4                             Unit Ontology                                                     UO #> 5  Chemical Entities of Biological Interest                                                  CHEBI #> 6         Phenotypic qualities (properties)                                                   PATO #> 7 ArrayExpress Experimental Factor Ontology                                                    EFO #>   version #> 1   47893 #> 2  v 1.26 #> 3  v 1.26 #> 4  v 1.26 #> 5  v 1.26 #> 6  v 1.26 #> 7  v 1.26 ## Update version number. isaOSR[1, "version"] <- 47894  ## Update oSR in ISAjson object. oSR(isaObject1) <- isaOSR  ## Check the updated oSR. oSR(isaObject1) #>                                 description                                             file  name #> 1    Ontology for Biomedical Investigations http://bioportal.bioontology.org/ontologies/1123   OBI #> 2             BRENDA tissue / enzyme source        ArrayExpress Experimental Factor Ontology   BTO #> 3            NEWT UniProt Taxonomy Database                                                   NEWT #> 4                             Unit Ontology                                                     UO #> 5  Chemical Entities of Biological Interest                                                  CHEBI #> 6         Phenotypic qualities (properties)                                                   PATO #> 7 ArrayExpress Experimental Factor Ontology                                                    EFO #>   version #> 1   47894 #> 2  v 1.26 #> 3  v 1.26 #> 4  v 1.26 #> 5  v 1.26 #> 6  v 1.26 #> 7  v 1.26

title: An introduction to the isajsonr package
text: assay section may contain information files used store actual data assay. Per assay section two types data files may referred : 1) file(s) containing raw data, 2) file(s) containing derived data. Looking assay section example data, see a_proteome assay survey s_BII-S-1 contains raw derived data files, shown dataFileType column output. read contents data files, either raw derived, assay tab file, can use processAssay() function. exact working function depends technology type assay. technology types data files read plain .txt files assuming tab-delimited format. mass spectrometry microarray data files read differently (see sections ). protein assignment file example regular data file read . able process assay file, .e. read data, first extract assay tabs using getAssayTabs() function. function extracts assay files ISAjson object stores assayTab objects. assayTab objects contain content assay tab file, also extra information, e.g. technology type. data now stored isaDat can used analysis within R.
code: ## Inspect assay tab for survey s_BII-S-1. isaAFile <- aFiles(isaObject1) head(isaAFile$`s_BII-S-1.txt`$a_proteome.txt) #>                                                    dataFile@id                   dataFilename #> 1                     #data/proteinassignmentfile-proteins.csv                   proteins.csv #> 2 #data/derivedspectraldatafile-PRIDE_Exp_Complete_Ac_8763.xml PRIDE_Exp_Complete_Ac_8763.xml #> 3                    #data/rawspectraldatafile-spectrum.mzdata                spectrum.mzdata #> 4   #data/posttranslationalmodificationassignmentfile-ptms.csv                       ptms.csv #> 5 #data/derivedspectraldatafile-PRIDE_Exp_Complete_Ac_8762.xml PRIDE_Exp_Complete_Ac_8762.xml #> 6 #data/derivedspectraldatafile-PRIDE_Exp_Complete_Ac_8761.xml PRIDE_Exp_Complete_Ac_8761.xml #>                                      dataFiletype dataFileComment[PRIDE Accession] #> 1                         Protein Assignment File                             8761 #> 2                      Derived Spectral Data File                             8763 #> 3                          Raw Spectral Data File                             8761 #> 4 Post Translational Modification Assignment File                             8761 #> 5                      Derived Spectral Data File                             8762 #> 6                      Derived Spectral Data File                             8761 #>   dataFileComment[PRIDE Processed Data Accession] #> 1                                            8761 #> 2                                            8763 #> 3                                            8761 #> 4                                            8761 #> 5                                            8762 #> 6                                            8761 ## Get assay tabs for isaObject1. aTabObjects <- getAssayTabs(isaObject1) aTabObjects$`s_BII-S-1.txt`[[2]]@aFile <- aTabObjects$`s_BII-S-1.txt`[[2]]@aFile[!startsWith(aTabObjects$`s_BII-S-1.txt`[[2]]@aFile$dataFilename, prefix = "/"), ]  ## Process assay data. isaDat <- processAssay(isaObject = isaObject1,                        aTabObject = aTabObjects$`s_BII-S-1.txt`[[2]],                        type = "derived") #> Error in bpstopOnError(BPPARAM) : could not find function "bpstopOnError"   ## Display first rows and columns. #head(isaDat[, 1:10])

title: An introduction to the isajsonr package
text: Mass spectrometry data often stored Network Common Data Form (NetCDF) files, .e. .CDF files. Assay data containing data processed different way regular assay data. able xcms package required. package available Bioconductor. reading ISA-Tab files, can now process mass spectrometry assay data. example raw data available, processing assay specify type = "raw". rest code similar previous section. output shows, processing mass spectrometry data gives object class xcmsSet xcms package. object contains available information .CDF file read can used analysis.
code: ## Get assay tabs for isaObject3. # aTabObjects3 <- getAssayTabs(isaObject3) #  # ## Process assay data. # isaDat3 <- processAssay(isaObject = isaObject3, #                         aTabObject = aTabObjects3$s_Proteomic_profiling_of_yeast.txt$a_metabolite.txt, #                         type = "raw") #  # ## Display output. # isaDat3

title: An introduction to the isajsonr package
text: Microarray data often stored Affymetrix Probe Results file. .CEL files contain information probe set’s intensity values, probe set represents gene. Assay data containing data processed different way regular assay data. able affy package required. package available Bioconductor. Processing microarray data done similar way processing mass spectrometry data, described previous section. main difference resulting object case object object class ExpressionSet, used input many Bioconductor packages.

what: Writing files in the ISA-JSON format.
title: An introduction to the isajsonr package
text: updating ISAjson object, can written back directory using writeISAjson() function. content ISAjson object written json file following ISA-JSON standard specifications. location output file specified file argument.
code: ## Write content of ISA object to a temporary file. writeISAjson(isaObject = isaObject1,               file = tempfile())

title: Authors and Citation
text: Bart-Jan van Rossum. Author, maintainer.

title: Authors and Citation
text: van Rossum B (2024). isajsonr: Implementation ISA Abstract Model. R package version 0.0.1, https://github.com/Biometris/isajsonr/, https://biometris.github.io/isajsonr/index.html.
code: @Manual{,   title = {isajsonr: Implementation for the ISA Abstract Model},   author = {Bart-Jan {van Rossum}},   year = {2024},   note = {R package version 0.0.1, https://github.com/Biometris/isajsonr/},   url = {https://biometris.github.io/isajsonr/index.html}, }

what: An R package for reading, modifying and writing ISA-JSON files
title: An R package for reading, modifying and writing ISA-JSON files
text: isajsonr R package easily reading, modifying writing files Investigation/Study/Assay (ISA) Abstract Model metadata framework using JSON format.

title: An R package for reading, modifying and writing ISA-JSON files
text: Install CRAN: Install latest development version GitHub (requires remotes package):
code: install.packages("isajsonr") remotes::install_github("Biometris/isajsonr", ref = "develop", dependencies = TRUE)

title: isajsonr package overview. — isajsonr-package
text: isajsonr package implementation ISA-JSON format R. builds R object ISA-JSON format files. ISA metadata framework manage increasingly diverse set life science, environmental biomedical experiments employ one combination technologies. Built around **Investigation** (project context), **Study** (unit research) **Assay** (analytical measurements) concepts, ISA helps provide rich descriptions experimental metadata (.e. sample characteristics, technology measurement types, sample--data relationships) resulting data discoveries reproducible reusable.
